pullRequest.body:
This PR adds the lemmas one_lt_zpow₀ and zpow_lt_zpow_right₀ to Algebra.Order.GroupWithZero.Canonical.lean .
Co-authored-by: Christian Merten (github: chrisflav).
Used in project Formalization of the Bruhat-Tits Tree. 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [6eb1417f93](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17405/commits/6eb1417f93c9ff9982e78f42a1ab8592052e7c29)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +2.42% | `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.GroupWithZero.Canonical` |

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Algebra.Order.GroupWithZero.Canonical | 372 | 381 | +9 (+2.42%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
|<details><summary>6 files</summary> `Mathlib.Order.Grade` `Mathlib.Control.LawfulFix` `Mathlib.Algebra.Homology.Embedding.Basic` `Mathlib.Data.Nat.Cast.SetInterval` `Mathlib.Data.PNat.Factors` `Mathlib.Data.Int.SuccPred`</details>|1|
|<details><summary>5 files</summary> `Mathlib.Data.ENat.Basic` `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Nonneg.Ring` `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Nonneg.Field` `Mathlib.Algebra.Tropical.Lattice` `Mathlib.Algebra.Tropical.Basic`</details>|2|
|<details><summary>20 files</summary> `Mathlib.Control.Fix` `Mathlib.Data.PNat.Find` `Mathlib.Data.Nat.WithBot` `Mathlib.Data.Nat.Upto` `Mathlib.Data.Nat.Dist` `Mathlib.Data.Bool.Count` `Mathlib.Data.Nat.SuccPred` `Mathlib.Data.PNat.Prime` `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Field.Canonical.Defs` `Mathlib.SetTheory.Lists` `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Ring.Nat` `Mathlib.Data.PNat.Basic` `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Invertible` `Mathlib.Algebra.Group.PNatPowAssoc` `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Ring.Pow` `Mathlib.Data.Nat.Cast.Order.Ring` `Mathlib.Data.List.Iterate` `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Field.Canonical.Basic` `Mathlib.Tactic.Linarith.Lemmas` `Mathlib.Data.Nat.MaxPowDiv`</details>|3|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Hom.Ring`|7|
|<details><summary>4 files</summary> `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Monoid.ToMulBot` `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.GroupWithZero.WithZero` `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.GroupWithZero.Canonical` `Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Hom.Monoid`</details>|9|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ one_lt_zpow₀`
`+ pow_lt_pow₀`
`+ zpow_lt_zpow_right₀`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
!bench
What is the file suggested by `find_home!`?
@YaelDillies what do you think of the new import list?

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/a13cda04-3582-47f5-a214-c4171a422504) for commit 96d56021a99a50bbf8b4485ea21a9799ac746488.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/178d667d-a961-43f5-9add-711a0c699013/to/a13cda04-3582-47f5-a214-c4171a422504) against commit 4e8b403f7c8122324fc4168c099e8010756010ac.

> What is the file suggested by `find_home!`?

for `one_lt_zpow₀` it gives me [Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Basic, Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Basic, Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.AffineSpace.MidpointZero, Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.AffineSpace.Ordered, Mathlib.Algebra.CharP.Basic, Mathlib.GroupTheory.OrderOfElement, Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPolynomial.Basic, Mathlib.Data.Matrix.CharP, Mathlib.ModelTheory.Algebra.Field.CharP, Mathlib.Algebra.CharP.Algebra, Mathlib.Data.Complex.Module] 
and for the second one this:
[Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Ring.Cast, Mathlib.Data.Nat.Cast.SetInterval, Mathlib.Order.Interval.Finset.Box, Mathlib.Data.Int.SuccPred, Mathlib.Algebra.Order.Ring.Abs, Mathlib.Data.Int.Star].

This lemma should probably not exist at all. Does `one_lt_zpow` not satisfy your needs? If not, I am currently doing a series of PRs unifying the `LinearOrderedField` and `LinearOrderedCommGroupWithZero` versions of lemmas. See eg #17215 and #17378.

> This lemma should probably not exist at all. Does `one_lt_zpow` not satisfy your needs? If not, I am currently doing a series of PRs unifying the `LinearOrderedField` and `LinearOrderedCommGroupWithZero` versions of lemmas. See eg #17215 and #17378.

Why do you think the lemma (I assume you are refering to `one_lt_zpow₀`) should not exist? 

`one_lt_zpow` seems to be for semifields, right?  
We are working with valuation rings and the target of a valuation is a `LinearOrderedCommGroupWithZero`. So this seems to be the right context.

See the PRs I referred to: This series of PRs will soon generalise `one_lt_zpow` so that it also works for `LinearOrderedCommGroupWithZero`

EDIT: The PRs were merged

I'm closing the PR as the lemmas [one_lt_zpow₀](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/GroupWithZero/Unbundled.html#one_lt_zpow%E2%82%80) and [zpow_lt_zpow_right₀](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Order/GroupWithZero/Unbundled.html#zpow_lt_zpow_right%E2%82%80) were added in the meantime by @YaelDillies.

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/Order/GroupWithZero): add one_lt_zpow₀ and zpow_lt_zpow_right₀
